blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Come Back To Me
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DTqX4f

by Lone_Wolf_Fanfics

Once upon a time Thor and Loki both fell in love with the same woman, Mila, Frigga’s apprentice. But when she fell in love with Thor, Loki became jealous and lashed out, killed her.

Now 1,000 years later Loki walks into a occult store and meets Mila Winchester, a reincarnation of woman he murdered a millennium ago. And he’s determined to keep her this time.

Words: 8022, Chapters: 8/30, Language: English

Series: Part 7 of Supernatural/Marvel Crossovers, Part 10 of Marvel, Part 4 of Supernatural

  • Fandoms: Thor (Movies), Supernatural, Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, Multi
  • Characters: Sam Winchester, Dean Winchester, Thor (Marvel), Loki (Marvel), Tony Stark, Castiel (Supernatural), Rowena MacLeod, John Winchester, Frigga (Marvel), Clint Barton, James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers
  • Relationships: Loki/Thor/Original Character(s) (Marvel), Loki (Marvel)/Original Female Character(s), Thor (Marvel)/Original Female Character(s)
  • Additional Tags: Witches, Magic, Reincarnation


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2DTqX4f

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

blog.name: itsanerdlife
blog.title: Ama
blog.description: 20's II Married. || Hufflepuff. II Kingsman - Marvel Fanfic Writer. II Beta Reader// Editor // Partner @Mo320 II Master List

title: Nothing Is Forever 13
body:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Sick!Reader

Warning: Reader has a life threatening illness. Mentions of wanting to die. Hospital trips. Seriously sick moments. Mentions of miscarriage. Mentions of losing baby. Language. Self hate. Secrets. Sass, lots of sass.

A/N: Reader is Peter’s sister, They’re adopted by Tony and Pepper, who have Howie as well. So She’s Peter and Howie’s younger sister. Just a heads up.

Tag List Is Open!!

He stopped outside the door as Howie walks in. He can hear her inside the room.

“Mmm, hand me that water, please?” She asks her brother, her voice light and soft.

“Y/N.” Howie struggles, clearly giving his sister whatever it was she asked for.

“Howie why do you look so guilty?” She giggles, a ragged cough follows. His chest tightens at the harsh sound coming from her.

“You’re going to kill me.” Howie sighs, he whistles. Letting Steve know he was to come in.

“What did you do?” She snorts. He steps into the little hospital room. It’s sleek, smooth and covered in her things. The overhead light is off, and her bed side lights are on, bathing the room in soft light. Her eyes dart from Howie to him.

“Howie I’m going to kill you!” She rasps, whipping the hair brush in her hand at Howie. It hits Howie dead on, he winces. His mouth opens, but nothing comes out. She moves off the bed, catching the IV on the edge of the bed. “Ow! Fuck!” She turns adjusting the tube.

“Y/N.” He steps forward.

“What the,” Peter hurries into the room he stops in his steps “oh fuck.” He nods, looking Steve over.

“You need to leave. Now.” Y/N turns growling.

“No.” He tucks his hands into the pockets of his jeans. She starts seething instantly.

“Both of you, get the fuck out!” She points at the door.

“Howard, hallway.” Peter jerks his thumb and Howie scrambles away from his sister.

“Y/N, what the hell?” Steve steps forward.

“This is none of your business. Go.” She refuses to look at him, she’s poking at her IV in the back of her hand.

“No.” Steve scuffs. “I’m staying. I told you I was going to fight your stubborn ass.” He shrugs.

“You’re supposed to be in bed.” Peter holds up his hands as if he was saying he wasn’t joining the fight, just pointing things out.

“Fuck off.” She glares at him, there’s a raspy, congested sound coming from her. She plays with the ends of the massive black, knitted sweater she had on, over her black leggings, she has fuzzy pink socks on. Her wild waves are trapped up into an unkept ponytail on her head.

“Get into that bed before I manhandle you.” He sighs, she glares at him. “You can yell at me from there.” He nods.

“Don’t tell me what to do.” She grumbles. He nods.

“Fine.” He moves towards her.

“You wouldn’t dare!” She points at him. “Oh my god!” She croaks, as he lifts her by the waist and steps towards the hospital bed, placing her in the opening she had started out in.

“Now, stay.” He points, moving the IV stand closer.

“Rude!” She coughs into her sweater sleeves, covering her hands. Peter sighs, rolling his eyes. Steve drops into the other chair, closest to her bedside.

“Um.” A nurse pops her head into the room. “Your brother wanted your IV checked.” She looks between the three of them.

“She stood up fast. Caught it on the bed edge.” Peter nods.

“It’s fine.” Y/N grumbles in an angry voice.

“Let’s just be sure.” The nurse smiles, moving towards her. Y/N and him sat glaring at each other, Peter watching the both of them, the nurse checking Y/N’s hand. “Might bruise a little, but I think that’s the least of your issues with what you’re facing tonight.” She smiles at Y/N before she leaves the room. He lifts his brow, looking at Y/N.

“Nurses just can’t keep their mouths shut.” She mutters.

“Now tell me what is going on? Is this why you think you’re no good for me anymore?” Steve flicks his hand, his elbow resting on the arm of the chair.

“No.” Y/N scuffs. Peter snorts. “Yes.” Y/N shrugs. “It’s too hard to explain.” She sighs.

“How long have you been sick?” He clenches his jaw.

“It’s complicated. It’s not your problem, this has nothing to do with you Steve.” She shakes her head. Peter scuffs.

“Is that what you think? I’m in love with you, this has everything to do with me.” He tone offended.

“No it doesn’t!” She yells, she adjusts the oxygen tube resting under her nose. “You were supposed to move on! Live a fucking happy life, have more than this!” She waves the IV hand and the other hand holding the length of the oxygen tube. “I wanted more for you!” She was instantly pissed. Howie mentioned mood swings were common with her illness.

“Is that why you left me?!” He sits up suddenly. “Have you been sick this whole time!?” He stares at her. “Are you so stupid, you don’t get it? There is no happy fucking life, there is no, more without you!” He balls his hands resting on his thighs.

“There’s no life with me!” She snaps, throwing up her free hand.

“Christ.” Peter mutters, his jaw ticks and his head shakes.

“What?” Steve looks over at him.

“Peter, shut up.” She warns him.

“No!” Peter snaps. His brow lifts, Peter never yelled at Y/N. Not even when she backed into his car on three different occasions. “Fess up, Y/N!” He grips the back of the chair. “She’s got a life threatening TBI. If not properly taken care of, it will kill her!” Peter snaps, looking over at him. He licks his lips looking back to Y/N.

“Are you taking care of it?” He asks, trying to remain calm. She shifts looking down at her legging covered legs.

“No, she refuses!” Peter shakes the chair for a moment. “At least till you came around.” Peter looks over at him. “She thinks she has to pay with her life, she’s got some fucked up death sentence because of what happened to your daughter.” Peter bites out. Y/N sucks in air, shocked Peter threw her under the bus. Steve swallows, it all lead back to their daughter.

“I hate you!” Y/N coughs, covering her face.

“Yeah well I love you too much to watch you die.” Peter’s voice is flat, distaste in his words.

“Why do you have to die, because she didn’t survive?” Steve grinds out slowly. She sniffs lowering her hands.

“Because it’s my fault. I’m the reason our daughter died.” She admits in a small voice.

trail.content_raw:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Sick!Reader

Warning: Reader has a life threatening illness. Mentions of wanting to die. Hospital trips. Seriously sick moments. Mentions of miscarriage. Mentions of losing baby. Language. Self hate. Secrets. Sass, lots of sass.

A/N: Reader is Peter’s sister, They’re adopted by Tony and Pepper, who have Howie as well. So She’s Peter and Howie’s younger sister. Just a heads up.

Tag List Is Open!!

[[MORE]]

He stopped outside the door as Howie walks in. He can hear her inside the room.

“Mmm, hand me that water, please?” She asks her brother, her voice light and soft.

“Y/N.” Howie struggles, clearly giving his sister whatever it was she asked for.

“Howie why do you look so guilty?” She giggles, a ragged cough follows. His chest tightens at the harsh sound coming from her.

“You’re going to kill me.” Howie sighs, he whistles. Letting Steve know he was to come in.

“What did you do?” She snorts. He steps into the little hospital room. It’s sleek, smooth and covered in her things. The overhead light is off, and her bed side lights are on, bathing the room in soft light. Her eyes dart from Howie to him.

“Howie I’m going to kill you!” She rasps, whipping the hair brush in her hand at Howie. It hits Howie dead on, he winces. His mouth opens, but nothing comes out. She moves off the bed, catching the IV on the edge of the bed. “Ow! Fuck!” She turns adjusting the tube.

“Y/N.” He steps forward.

“What the,” Peter hurries into the room he stops in his steps “oh fuck.” He nods, looking Steve over.

“You need to leave. Now.” Y/N turns growling.

“No.” He tucks his hands into the pockets of his jeans. She starts seething instantly.

“Both of you, get the fuck out!” She points at the door.

“Howard, hallway.” Peter jerks his thumb and Howie scrambles away from his sister.

“Y/N, what the hell?” Steve steps forward.

“This is none of your business. Go.” She refuses to look at him, she’s poking at her IV in the back of her hand.

“No.” Steve scuffs. “I’m staying. I told you I was going to fight your stubborn ass.” He shrugs.

“You’re supposed to be in bed.” Peter holds up his hands as if he was saying he wasn’t joining the fight, just pointing things out.

“Fuck off.” She glares at him, there’s a raspy, congested sound coming from her. She plays with the ends of the massive black, knitted sweater she had on, over her black leggings, she has fuzzy pink socks on. Her wild waves are trapped up into an unkept ponytail on her head.

“Get into that bed before I manhandle you.” He sighs, she glares at him. “You can yell at me from there.” He nods.

“Don’t tell me what to do.” She grumbles. He nods.

“Fine.” He moves towards her.

“You wouldn’t dare!” She points at him. “Oh my god!” She croaks, as he lifts her by the waist and steps towards the hospital bed, placing her in the opening she had started out in.

“Now, stay.” He points, moving the IV stand closer.

“Rude!” She coughs into her sweater sleeves, covering her hands. Peter sighs, rolling his eyes. Steve drops into the other chair, closest to her bedside.

“Um.” A nurse pops her head into the room. “Your brother wanted your IV checked.” She looks between the three of them.

“She stood up fast. Caught it on the bed edge.” Peter nods.

“It’s fine.” Y/N grumbles in an angry voice.

“Let’s just be sure.” The nurse smiles, moving towards her. Y/N and him sat glaring at each other, Peter watching the both of them, the nurse checking Y/N’s hand. “Might bruise a little, but I think that’s the least of your issues with what you’re facing tonight.” She smiles at Y/N before she leaves the room. He lifts his brow, looking at Y/N.

“Nurses just can’t keep their mouths shut.” She mutters.

“Now tell me what is going on? Is this why you think you’re no good for me anymore?” Steve flicks his hand, his elbow resting on the arm of the chair.

“No.” Y/N scuffs. Peter snorts. “Yes.” Y/N shrugs. “It’s too hard to explain.” She sighs.

“How long have you been sick?” He clenches his jaw.

“It’s complicated. It’s not your problem, this has nothing to do with you Steve.” She shakes her head. Peter scuffs.

“Is that what you think? I’m in love with you, this has everything to do with me.” He tone offended.

“No it doesn’t!” She yells, she adjusts the oxygen tube resting under her nose. “You were supposed to move on! Live a fucking happy life, have more than this!” She waves the IV hand and the other hand holding the length of the oxygen tube. “I wanted more for you!” She was instantly pissed. Howie mentioned mood swings were common with her illness.

“Is that why you left me?!” He sits up suddenly. “Have you been sick this whole time!?” He stares at her. “Are you so stupid, you don’t get it? There is no happy fucking life, there is no, more without you!” He balls his hands resting on his thighs.

“There’s no life with me!” She snaps, throwing up her free hand.

“Christ.” Peter mutters, his jaw ticks and his head shakes.

“What?” Steve looks over at him.

“Peter, shut up.” She warns him.

“No!” Peter snaps. His brow lifts, Peter never yelled at Y/N. Not even when she backed into his car on three different occasions. “Fess up, Y/N!” He grips the back of the chair. “She’s got a life threatening TBI. If not properly taken care of, it will kill her!” Peter snaps, looking over at him. He licks his lips looking back to Y/N.

“Are you taking care of it?” He asks, trying to remain calm. She shifts looking down at her legging covered legs.

“No, she refuses!” Peter shakes the chair for a moment. “At least till you came around.” Peter looks over at him. “She thinks she has to pay with her life, she’s got some fucked up death sentence because of what happened to your daughter.” Peter bites out. Y/N sucks in air, shocked Peter threw her under the bus. Steve swallows, it all lead back to their daughter.

“I hate you!” Y/N coughs, covering her face.

“Yeah well I love you too much to watch you die.” Peter’s voice is flat, distaste in his words.

“Why do you have to die, because she didn’t survive?” Steve grinds out slowly. She sniffs lowering her hands.

“Because it’s my fault. I’m the reason our daughter died.” She admits in a small voice.
